summary: Treasure Maps of Skyrim is a retexture of all twelve vanilla Skyrim Treasure Maps. Brand new paper textures and hand-drawn images come together to enhance your Treasure Hunting.
descriptionHtml:
[img]http://www.dcoffey.co.uk/images/treasuremapsskyrim/TMS_Banner_Large.jpg[/img]

This mod adds all NEW hand-drawn textures and [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/48471]Better Notes Mesh[/url] optimised meshes for all twelve of the vanilla Skyrim Treasure Maps. They are not up-sampled or sharpened vanilla resources... they are faithful to the content and style of the originals but they are NEW.

This mod is intended for anyone who is not using the [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/35399]Book Covers Skyrim[/url] mod or who does use that mod but with the No Notes installation option. All these Treasure Maps are included in the latest version of Book Covers Skyrim.

There are two versions of the textures provided. The ORIGINAL texture set is where the maps are brighter and somewhat more colourful. For players without an ENB, this is the recommended choice. The DESATURATED texture set looks a bit more muted and aged. If you use an ENB then you should choose that option.


[img]http://www.dcoffey.co.uk/images/treasuremapsskyrim/TMS_About.jpg[/img]

OPTIONS:
- Textures : Original or Desaturated


MAPS AFFECTED:
- Treasure Map I
- Treasure Map II
- Treasure Map III
- Treasure Map IV
- Treasure Map V
- Treasure Map VI
- Treasure Map VII
- Treasure Map VIII
- Treasure Map IX
- Treasure Map X
- Treasure Map - Fort Neugrad
- Treasure Map - Velehk Sain


COMPATIBILITY:
- Unofficial Skyrim Patch
- Sorting Mods if loaded after them


INSTALLERS:
- BAIN
- FOMOD


LANGUAGES:
- English
- French
- German
- Italian
- Spanish
- Russian
- Polish
- Czech


LOAD ORDER:
- Unofficial Patches
- ...
- Sorting mods (Optional)
- ...
- Treasure Maps of Skyrim.esp


Installation:

a) Use either Wrye Bash, NMM or ModOrganizer to install the mod.
b) Manual: Download the file. Move the contents of the "01 Treasure Maps ESP" folder and your choice of EITHER the "01 Treasure Maps BSA Original" OR "01 Treasure Maps BSA Desaturated" folders to your Skyrim/Data directory and activate the .esp file.

Uninstallation:

a) Use either Wrye Bash or one of NMM or ModOrganizer to remove the mod.
b) Manual: Remove the Treasure Maps Skyrim.esp andTreasure Maps Skyrim.bsa from your Skyrim/Data directory. This mod will NOT affect your save game as it does not include any scripts. It can be removed at any time.
author: DanielCoffey
